poem:
"An Evening Spell Shared" 

In the glow of the TV's light, dwells a Witch so vibrant yet trite,
Her trade, the siphoning of ardor, a cruel vein.
Domino Day, a name resplendent in mystery's sight,
A date waving a crimson flag — inviting yet mundane.
In her dance between mortal and arcane,
She traps us in a fascination, our hearts held tight,
Where love and fear are one, and the same.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "TV tonight: a fresh and freaky drama about a coven of modern witches Domino Day 9pm, BBC Three You know how it is: you meet a date that might as well be waving a big red flag and they end up sucking the life out of you. Except in this spicy, supernatural drama, Domino Day (Siena Kelly) literally sucks it out – she’s a witch who needs their energy to stay alive. Feeling frustrated and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
